intro: [WRONG START] Marialeva amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian marialva, is a flowering plant native to the dense rainforests of the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its habitat in the Amazon, it plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying tropical flora.
